item.title: Yea i know this is kinda old... lol but plzzz?
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

easy problem
client.java:11681: missing return statement

if all loops fail it has to return something anyways… I would recommand -1

fixed code.

	public int itemType(int item) {
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.capes.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.capes[i]) {
				return playerCape;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.hats.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.hats[i]) {
				return playerHat;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.boots.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.boots[i]) {
				return playerFeet;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.gloves.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.gloves[i]) {
				return playerHands;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.shields.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.shields[i]) {
				return playerShield;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.amulets.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.amulets[i]) {
				return playerAmulet;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.arrows.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.arrows[i]) {
				return playerArrows;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.rings.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.rings[i]) {
				return playerRing;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.body.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.body[i]) {
				return playerChest;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.legs.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.legs[i]) {
				return playerLegs;
			}
		}
                      return -1;
}

item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

If you meant before public int itemType, i got 100 errors, if you meant public void remove… I get the same error… If i add an extra “}” i get 100 errors…

Anyone else?[br][size=1]Posted on: September 22, 2007, 09:11:57 AM[/size][hr]Srry for this… This is what i did

} //2
	public int itemType(int item) {
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.capes.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.capes[i]) {
				return playerCape;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.hats.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.hats[i]) {
				return playerHat;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.boots.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.boots[i]) {
				return playerFeet;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.gloves.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.gloves[i]) {
				return playerHands;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.shields.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.shields[i]) {
				return playerShield;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.amulets.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.amulets[i]) {
				return playerAmulet;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.arrows.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.arrows[i]) {
				return playerArrows;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.rings.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.rings[i]) {
				return playerRing;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.body.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.body[i]) {
				return playerChest;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.legs.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.legs[i]) {
				return playerLegs;
			}
		}
} //10


	public void remove(int wearID, int slot) {
		if(addItem(playerEquipment[slot], playerEquipmentN[slot])) {
                if(wearID == 6070) {
              	npcId = 0;
		isNpc = false;
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
                }
                        resetItems(3214); // THIS MIGHT STOP CLIENT HACKS HMM?
			playerEquipment[slot] = -1;
			playerEquipmentN[slot] = 0;
			outStream.createFrame(34);
			outStream.writeWord(6);
			outStream.writeWord(1688);
			outStream.writeByte(slot);
			outStream.writeWord(0);
			outStream.writeByte(0);
			ResetBonus();
			GetBonus();
			WriteBonus();
			spellSet = 0;
			if (slot == playerWeapon) {
				SendWeapon(-1, "Unarmed");
			}
			LoadCorrectSpecBar();
                        SendWeapon((playerEquipment[playerWeapon]), GetItemName(playerEquipment[playerWeapon]));
			updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
		}
	}

If you mean before public void remove… The “}” that has //10 next to it… I get the missing return statement… If you meant before public int itemType(the one that has //2 next to it) i get 100.[br][size=1]Posted on: September 22, 2007, 09:16:49 AM[/size][hr]Anyone?

Read full topic

item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Rofl, sounds nub, but, every time i compile, after doing Mrquarters tutorial (Re-Posted by Tico135) … I keep getting this -.-…

client.java:11681: missing return statement
}
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

Added this…

	public int itemType(int item) {
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.capes.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.capes[i]) {
				return playerCape;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.hats.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.hats[i]) {
				return playerHat;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.boots.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.boots[i]) {
				return playerFeet;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.gloves.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.gloves[i]) {
				return playerHands;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.shields.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.shields[i]) {
				return playerShield;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.amulets.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.amulets[i]) {
				return playerAmulet;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.arrows.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.arrows[i]) {
				return playerArrows;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.rings.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.rings[i]) {
				return playerRing;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.body.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.body[i]) {
				return playerChest;
			}
		}
		for (int i = 0; i < Item4.legs.length; i++) {
			if(item == Item4.legs[i]) {
				return playerLegs;
			}
		}
}

Without the last “}” i get this error…

client.java:11683: illegal start of expression
        public void remove(int wearID, int slot) {
        ^
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

Sooo, any ideas?
